newsitem.title: USA: Children's Broadcasting buys Ariz. license.
newsitem.headline: Children's Broadcasting buys Ariz. license.

text.p: Children's Broadcasting Corp said it has acquired the radio broadcast license of KIDR-AM 740, licensed to the city of Phoenix, Ariz.

Children's Broadcasting, which acquired the radio station from Bonneville International Corp and Bonneville Holding Co, Salt Lake City, has been broadcasting Aahs World Radio format for kids and families on KIDR since October 1992, when the station first signed on as an Aahs affiliate.
Aahs World Radio is a live, 24-hour radio network for kids and families. Its radio programming includes music, news, original stories, games and prizes.
With Phoenix, Children's Broadcasting said late THursday that it owns stations in 10 of the top twenty markets, including six of the top 10.
